subject: Re: New brief: Physical activity guide

full_threads.body: Logged 5mins to Harvest
@jona +5mins Thanks!

Hi Lizzy,

Confirming we have updated the social images and the donate button on the email. 
Let me know if this works for you? Cheers!

Hi,

Here's a screenshot of the latest email on desktop - the donate button is still not quite right and the social icons are quite disproportionately large (I checked on mobile though and it all looks fine there interestingly)…

I'll just give it another test - and come back to you asap.

Meanwhile, totally happy for you to add the link to the menu now as I've put a homepage carousel item up now anyway 😊

Thanks for all your help on this project.

Lizzy
Logged 10 mins to Harvest
@jona +10mins Thanks!

HI Lizzy,

Sure, we have updated the email. Let me know if this works for you? 

Regarding adding the link on the menu. Do you want to add it now? or add it after everything is done?

Hi Joel,

Great - thank you! Ahh ok - yep I'm seeing a different layout (and mine doesn't have the footer either…)

So the donate button looks odd and the footer is missing compared to your screenshot…

Also, as that's the first time I've seen the footer - could you update it so it's more like the one in my email signature below (the round social icons) and not on a black background?



Aside from the email, are you ok to add a link to the page as a dropdown option under the 'For people with MS' nav bar? To sit below the 'MS Treatments' and to be called 'Physical Activity Guide'



Thanks

Lizzy



Lizzy Morton

Marketing and Communications Manager

MS Research Australia

02 8413 7912• 1300 356 467

emorton@msra.org.au• http://www.msra.org.au/

Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060

If you are not the intended recipient, do not read, use, disseminate, distribute or copy this message or attachments. If you have received this message in error, please notify the sender immediately and delete this message. Any views expressed in this message are those of the individual sender, except where the sender expressly, and with authority, states them to be the views of MS Research Australia. Before opening any attachments, please check them for viruses and defects.
Logged 15 mins to Harvest
@jona +15mins Thanks!

Hi Lizzy,

Confirming we have updated the emails and publish the pages. 
- List of entries. https://msra.org.au/wp-admin/admin.php?page=gf_entries&id=21
- Export Entries. Forms > Import/Export > Export Entries > "Physical activity: A guide for people with MS". 

I have attached a sample email layout. If you are seeing a different layout. Can you send us the screenshot? Cheers!
P.s - Happy for you to put the two pages live by the way - we just won't draw attention to it until I put an item on the edge slider 😊

Hi Joel, Great - thank you. The email is looking great! Just a couple of small tweaks on that and then I think we're all good. If you could make the changes asap this afternoon I'd be so grateful as we need to go live asap. On the email
  • Can the email 'from' alias be updated to: MS Research Australia (so you don't see enquiries@msra.org.au when it first appears in your inbox)
  • Can the email subject line remove the '- form'? So it should just read: Physical Activity: A Guide For People With MS
  • Can the 'donate' button be more like the CTA button on the webpage? It's currently appearing like this: But would much prefer it to look more like this (but in MS Research Australia 'red'):
  • I think the copy of the email looks blue on my screen - please could you make this black?
  • Could you also make the hyperlink 'here' bold and black?
On the webpages
  • When the banner image loads, I see a blue block colour banner first before the other one loads (I've had a couple of colleagues test it too on different internet connections but it still seems to be doing the same thing)
  • CTA button 'Get your FREE guide' > please could you add a drop shadow to it so it's in a similar style to the other buttons on our website?
Also, where abouts would I go in the back-end to download the info of people that submit the form? Thanks Lizzy
Logged 10 mins to Harvest
@jona  +10mins Thanks!

Hi lizzy,

Confirming we have updated email and turned on the redirect function.
Let me know if this works for you?
https://msra.org.au/physical-activity-a-guide-for-people-with-ms-form/

Hi Joel,

Just a quick one before we turn on and test - the automated email is currently coming to me regardless of who tests the form.

The intention of the email is similar to an event confirmation email in that it is supposed to send directly to the person who has submitted the form.

In the email I'd like there to be the same banner header to the email that is on the landing page.

I've mocked it up on the attached Word doc to hopefully explain this better.

Thanks

Lizzy
Logged 10 mins to harvest
@jona +10mins Thanks!
